meanings.definition: The process of coming into view or becoming exposed after being concealed.
meanings.sent1: The emergence of the sun from behind the clouds was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The emergence of new leaves on the trees signaled the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent3: The emergence of a clown from a tiny car always makes me laugh.
meanings.sent4: The emergence of stars in the night sky is like a sprinkle of fairy dust.
meanings.sent5: The sudden emergence of a rainbow after the rainstorm was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The process of becoming known or coming to light.
meanings.sent1: The emergence of the truth shocked everyone at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The emergence of her talent as a singer was unexpected but impressive.
meanings.sent3: The emergence of a squirrel in a magician's hat would be quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The emergence of a new idea can illuminate the path forward.
meanings.sent5: The gradual emergence of the city skyline at sunrise was mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: The process of arising or occurring unexpectedly.
meanings.sent1: The sudden emergence of a deer on the road startled the driver.
meanings.sent2: The emergence of a rainbow during the storm was a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent3: The emergence of a penguin in the desert would be quite unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The emergence of a solution to the problem was like a light bulb turning on.
meanings.sent5: The mysterious emergence of footprints in the sand puzzled the beachgoers.
